snippet: Though Brett McGurk served as an adviser to President George W. Bush, members of the Senate questioned the nomination.
abstract: Opposition mounts in the Senate to the nomination of Brett McGurk as the next ambassador to Iraq, as seven Republican senators recommend that his name be withdrawn from consideration; White House expresses support for its embattled nominee.
lead_paragraph: Though Brett McGurk served as an adviser to President George W. Bush, members of the Senate questioned the nomination.

headline.seo: Republicans Oppose McGurk as Next Iraq Ambassador
headline.main: G.O.P. Senators Oppose Choice for Iraq Envoy
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Senators Oppose Choice For Iraq Envoy
